instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: I have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that turns on cpu gets warm and usb mouse lights up but no image internal or external. backlight chip and 2 caps near it are currently off the board if that matters

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Matters WHY these components are missing now.
Any history fault available?
Someone else messed up with the board before?

Use better USB device than a mouse, to confirm (or not) the USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Was water damaged near the screen connector backlight chip and caps were removed because they didnt look so good connector is off the board as well was in very bad shape and what would i use for the usb. Laptop came in with no image on screen internal screen ended up working after replacing connector on it. No external image on board
